frame.name: Judgment
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes a judgment about an <fen>Evaluee</fen>. The judgment may be positive (e.g. <ment>respect</ment>) or negative (e.g. <ment>condemn</ment>), and this information is recorded in the semantic types Positive and Negative on the Lexical Units of this frame. There may be a specific <fen>Reason</fen> for the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s judgment, or there may be a capacity or <fen>Role</fen> in which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged. <ex></ex> This frame is distinct from the Judgment_communication frame in that this frame does not involve the Cognizer communicating his or her judgment to an Addressee. <ex>JUDGMENT: She <t>admired</t> Einstein for his character.</ex> <ex>JUDGMENT_COMMUNICATION: She <t>accused</t> Einstein of collusion.</ex> <ex></ex> Currently, however, some lexical units and annotation for both remain in this frame.</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the judgment. This role is typically expressed as the External Argument (or in a <ment>by</ment>-PP in passives). <ex><fex name="Cognizer">The boss</fex> <t>appreciates</t> you for your diligence.</ex> <ex><fex name="Cognizer">The boss</fex> is very <t>appreciative</t> of my work.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Evaluee
FE.definition: <def-root>Evaluee is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made. With verbs this FE is typically expressed as Object: <ex>The boss <t>appreciates</t> <fex name="Eval">you</fex> for your diligence. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Reason
FE.definition: <def-root>Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Reason</t> for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP, e.g. <ex>I <t>admire</t> you <fex name="Reason">for your intellect</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition: <def-root> <fen>Role</fen> is used for the capacity in which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged, and is expressed in <ment>as</ment>-PPs. <ex>I <t>admire</t> you <fex name="Role">as a composer</fex>.</ex></def-root >

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the judgment made by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>. <ex>She viewed him with an <t>appreciative</t> <fex name="Expressor">gaze</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the judging occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Depictive</fen> identifies any expression describing the state of a participant in the event. <ex>We <t>admire</t> him , <fex name="Depict">certain that he is a great leader</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> judges the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Topic</fen> identifies the entity to which the proposition or propositions conveyed relate. <ex>Jon was <t>disapproving</t> <fex name="Topic">about Madie's managerial style</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Extent_of_acclaim
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Extent_of_acclaim</fen> is a description of the number or locales of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>s. <ex><fex name="Evaluee">The proposal</fex> <m>gained</m><fex name="Extent_of_acclaim">widespread</fex> <t>approbation</t>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: accolade.n
lexUnit.definition: in schrift of druk dat regels verbindt
